verses.verse: Hear <WH8085> the right <WH6664>, O Lord <WH3068>, attend <WH7181> unto my cry <WH7440>, give ear <WH238> unto my prayer <WH8605>, that goes not <WH3808> out of feigned <WH4820> lips <WH8193>.
Let my sentence <WH4941> come forth <WH3318> from your presence <WH6440>; let your eyes <WH5869> behold <WH2372> the things that are equal <WH4339>.

You have proved <WH974> my heart <WH3820>; you have visited <WH6485> me in the night <WH3915>; you have tried <WH6884> me <WH4672>, and shall find nothing <WH2161>; I am purposed that my mouth <WH6310> shall not transgress <WH5674>.
Concerning the works <WH6468> of men <WH120>, by the word <WH1697> of your lips <WH8193> I have kept <WH8104> me from the paths <WH734> of the destroyer <WH6530>.
Hold up <WH8551> my goings <WH838> in your paths <WH4570>, that my footsteps <WH6471> slip not <WH4131>.
I have called <WH7121> upon you <WH6030>, for you will hear me <WH410>, O God: incline <WH5186> your ear <WH241> unto me <WH8085>, and hear my speech <WH565>.
Show your marvelous <WH6395> lovingkindness <WH2617>, O you that save <WH3467> by your right hand <WH3225> them which put their trust <WH2620> in you from those that rise up against them <WH6965>.
Keep <WH8104> me as the apple <WH380> of the eye <WH1323>, hide <WH5641> me under the shadow <WH6738> of your wings <WH3671>,
From <WH6440> the wicked <WH7563> that <WH2098> oppress <WH7703> me <WH5315>, from my deadly enemies <WH341>, who compass me about <WH5362>.
They are enclosed <WH5462> in their own fat <WH2459>: with their mouth <WH6310> they speak <WH1696> proudly <WH1348>.
They have now surrounded <WH5437> us in our steps <WH838>: they have set <WH7896> their eyes <WH5869> to throw us down <WH5186> to the earth <WH776>;
Like <WH1825> as a lion <WH738> that is greedy <WH3700> of his prey <WH2963>, and as it were a young lion <WH3715> lurking <WH3427> in secret places <WH4565>.
Arise <WH6965>, O Lord <WH3068>, disappoint <WH6923> him <WH6440>, cast him down <WH3766>: deliver <WH6403> my soul <WH5315> from the wicked <WH7563>, which is your sword <WH2719>:

From men <WH4962> which are your hand <WH3027>, O Lord <WH3068>, from men <WH4962> of the world <WH2465>, which have their portion <WH2506> in this life <WH2416>, and whose belly <WH990> you fill <WH4390> with your hid <WH6840> treasure <WH7646>: they are full of sons <WH1121>, and leave <WH3240> the rest <WH3499> of their substance to their babes <WH5768>.
As for me <WH2372>, I will behold your face <WH6440> in righteousness <WH6664>: I shall be satisfied <WH7646>, when I awake <WH6974>, with your likeness <WH8544>.
